en: And Jacob went on his way, and the angels of God met him.
hmr: Jakob chu a fe ta pei a; chun, Pathien vântirkohaiin an lo intuokpui a.

en: And Jacob said when he saw them, This is God’s host: and he called the name of that place Mahanaim.
hmr: Jakobin anni a hmu chun, “Hieng hi Pathien pâwlhai an nih,” a tih a; chuongchun, chu hmun hminga chun Mahanaim ân bûk a.

en: And Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother unto the land of Seir, the field of Edom.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chun Seir rama Edom phûl tienga a u Esau kuoma chun a hmaah zuolkohai ân tlântir a.

en: And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye say unto my lord Esau: Thus saith thy servant Jacob, I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed until now:
hmr: “Ka lalpa Esau kuoma chun hieng ang hin in hril ding a nih, ‘I siehlaw Jakobin hieng ang hin a ti a nih: Laban kuoma chun mikhuol ka nih a, tu chen hin ka um ta zing a.

en: and I have oxen, and asses, and flocks, and men-servants, and maid-servants: and I have sent to tell my lord, that I may find favor in thy sight.
hmr: Bâwngchal dâm, sabengtung le berâm dâm, suoknu le suokpa dâm ka nei bawk a, i lunginsietna ka hmu theina dingin, ka lalpa hril dingin mi ka hung tir a nih,’ a tih,” tiin, thu a pêk a.

en: And the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, We came to thy brother Esau, and moreover he cometh to meet thee, and four hundred men with him.
hmr: Chun, zuolkohai chu Jakob kuomah an hung kîr nâwk a, “I u Esau kuom kan va tlung a, mi za li hung ṭhuoiin a tuok ding chein a hung nghe nghe annaw,” an tih a.

en: Then Jacob was greatly afraid and was distressed: and he divided the people that were with him, and the flocks, and the herds, and the camels, into two companies;
hmr: Chuongchun, Jakob chu a ṭi êm êm a, a lunginzîng tah a; chun, a kuoma mi umhai dâm, berâm ruol le bâwng ruol dâm, sanghâwngseihai dâm chu pâwl hniin a siem a:

en: and he said, If Esau come to the one company, and smite it, then the company which is left shall escape.
hmr: Esau chu pâwl khatah a hunga a that khawmin pâwl khat la um chu tlân hmang thei an tih ti a ngaituoh a.

en: And Jacob said, O God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, O Jehovah, who saidst unto me, Return unto thy country, and to thy kindred, and I will do thee good:
hmr: Chun, Jakob bawk chun, “Aw ka pu Abraham Pathien, ka pa Isak Pathien, aw LALPA, ‘I ram tieng le i laibunghai lai fe nâwk ta rawh, chuongchun, siem ṭhâng ka ti che’ mi titu,

en: I am not worthy of the least of all the lovingkindnesses, and of all the truth, which thou hast showed unto thy servant; for with my staff I passed over this Jordan; and now I am become two companies.
hmr: i siehlaw chunga lunginsietna po po în langtir le thutak po po în langtir laia a chîntak khawm hi hmu tlâk ka ni nawh; hi Jordan hi ka hmawl le bak ka kân a; tuhin chu pâwl hni zet ka lo ni ta hi.

en: Deliver me, I pray thee, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau: for I fear him, lest he come and smite me, the mother with the children.
hmr: Lunginsiettakin ka u kuta inthawk, Esau kuta inthawk ngei chu mi sanhim rawh, nunau puma a mi hung that ka ṭi sih a.

en: And thou saidst, I will surely do thee good, and make thy seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.
hmr: Nangin, ‘Siem ṭha ngei ngei ka ti cheh a, i thlahai chu tuisuorieta phaiphin tiem sênglo khawp raua tam angin siem ka ti che,’ i ti sih a,” a tih a.

en: And he lodged there that night, and took of that which he had with him a present for Esau his brother:
hmr: Chun, chu zân chun chutaka chun a riek tah a; chun, a thil nei laia mi a u Esau ta dingin lâwmman dingin a sie tum a;

en: two hundred she-goats and twenty he-goats, two hundred ewes and twenty rams,
hmr: kêlpui za hni le kêlchal sâwm- hni, berâmpui za hni le berâmchal sâwmhni,

en: thirty milch camels and their colts, forty cows and ten bulls, twenty she-asses and ten foals.
hmr: sanghâwngsei sâwrlai sâwm- thum an tehai leh, bâwngpui sâwmli le bâwngchal sâwm, sabengtungpui sâwmhni le sabengtungchal sâwm leh.

en: And he delivered them into the hand of his servants, every drove by itself, and said unto his servants, Pass over before me, and put a space betwixt drove and drove.
hmr: Chun, chuonghai chu pâwl tin a tum sengin a siehlawhai kutah ân kawltir a: chun, a siehlawhai kuoma chun, “Ka hmaah fe kai unla, pâwl tin hi kâr inneitir pei ro,” a tih a.

en: And he commanded the foremost, saying, When Esau my brother meeteth thee, and asketh thee, saying, Whose art thou? and whither goest thou? and whose are these before thee?
hmr: A hmaṭhuoitu kuoma chun hieng hin thu a pêk a, “Ka u Esau chun ân tuokpui cheh a, ‘Tu mi am i nih a? Khâwlaia fe ding am? I hmaa umhai hi tu ta am?’ tiha ân dawn pha che chun,

en: then thou shalt say, They are thy servant Jacob’s; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and, behold, he also is behind us.
hmr: ‘I siehlaw Jakob ta an nih, pu Esau, i ta dingin lâwmmana ân phur che a ni hi: ama khawm kan hnungah a um’ ti rawh,” tiin.

en: And he commanded also the second, and the third, and all that followed the droves, saying, On this manner shall ye speak unto Esau, when ye find him;
hmr: A dawttu le, a dawt nâwktu le ran ruol khaltuhai po po kuoma khawm, “Esau in hmu pha chun chuong ang tak chun in hril ding a nih.

en: and ye shall say, Moreover, behold, thy servant Jacob is behind us. For he said, I will appease him with the present that goeth before me, and afterward I will see his face; peradventure he will accept me.
hmr: ‘Chun, ngai ta, i siehlaw Jakob chu kan hnunga sawn a um,’ ti bawk unla,” tiin thu a pêk seng a. “Lâwmman ka hmaa fe hin a lung sukdam ka ta, chu hnunga chun a hmêl hmûng ka tih; chuongchun, mi lo lâwm el a tih,” a ti a nih.

en: So the present passed over before him: and he himself lodged that night in the company.
hmr: Chuongchun, lâwmman chu a hmaa chun a fe kai tah a, ama ruokchu chu zân chun a pâwl lai chun a riek tah a.

en: And he rose up that night, and took his two wives, and his two handmaids, and his eleven children, and passed over the ford of the Jabbok.
hmr: Chu zân chun a tho a, a nuhmeihai pahni le, a suoknuhai pahni le, a nau sâwm le pakhathai chu a ṭhuoi a, Jabbok vadung kaia chun a kai tah a.

en: And he took them, and sent them over the stream, and sent over that which he had.
hmr: Chuongchun, anni chu a ṭhuoi a, vadung chu ân kaitir a, a nei po po khawm ân kaitir bawk a.

en: And Jacob was left alone; and there wrestled a man with him until the breaking of the day.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chu ama khât bakin a um tah a; chun, mi pakhatin ama chu khawfingchat chenin a buon a buon a.

en: And when he saw that he prevailed not against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh; and the hollow of Jacob’s thigh was strained, as he wrestled with him.
hmr: A hne nawh ti ân hrietin a êlpui ru suktuona lai hi a khîk pêk a; chuongchun, a buon lai chun Jakob êlpui ru insuktuokna chu a hung inpelsawl tah a.

en: And he said, Let me go, for the day breaketh. And he said, I will not let thee go, except thou bless me.
hmr: Chun, mi chun, “Mîn thla rawh, khawfing khawm a chat ding a ni ta hi,” a tih a. Jakob chun, “Mal i mi sâwm naw chun inthla naw ning che,” a tih a.

en: And he said unto him, What is thy name? And he said, Jacob.
hmr: Chun, mi chun a kuomah, “I hming iem a na?” a tih a. Ama chun, “Jakob,” a tih a.

en: And he said, Thy name shall be called no more Jacob, but Israel: for thou hast striven with God and with men, and hast prevailed.
hmr: Chun, mi chun, “I hming chu Jakob ti ta naw ni hai a, Israel ti lem tâng an ti che; Pathien le mihriem i thawh a, i hne ta sih a,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob asked him, and said, Tell me, I pray thee, thy name. And he said, Wherefore is it that thou dost ask after my name? And he blessed him there.
hmr: Chun, Jakobin ama chu ân dawn a, “Lunginsiettakin i hming mi hril rawh,” a tih a. Ama chun, “Iengleia ka hming indawn am i nih a?” a tih a. Chun, chutaka chun mal a sâwm tah a.

en: And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: for, said he, I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved.
hmr: Chun, Jakobin chu hmun hminga chun Peniel ân bûk tah a, “Pathien chu a hmaihma ngeiah ka hmuha chu ka hringna hi hla a ni sih a,” tiin.

en: And the sun rose upon him as he passed over Penuel, and he limped upon his thigh.
hmr: Chun, Peniel a suoksan lai tak chun nisa a hung suok a, ama chu a hung khawh a, a êlpui lei chun ân bâi tah a.

en: Therefore the children of Israel eat not the sinew of the hip which is upon the hollow of the thigh, unto this day: because he touched the hollow of Jacob’s thigh in the sinew of the hip.
hmr: Chuleiin, tu chen hin Israel thlahai chun êlpui ru suktuoha ke tha um hi an fâk ngai nawh: Jakob êlpui ru suktuo chu a ke tha laitaka a khîk leiin.
